checklist.Text: Don safety equipment
Gather equipment
Gather Reagents
Gather additional supplies
Fill a bucket with ice
Wrap a 967uL stock aliquot of S assay in aluminum foil
Thaw the S assay aliquot on ice
Homogenize the aliquot completely
Label 13 1.5mL amber tubes with printed S-gene Cryobaby labels.
Aliquot 75uL of S-gene primer-probe mix into each tube
Put a green sticker on the cap of each tube
Fill a bucket with ice
Wrap a 967uL stock aliquot of Orf1B assay in aluminum foil
Thaw the Orf1B assay aliquot on ice
Homogenize the aliquot completely
Label 13 1.5mL amber tubes with printed Orf1B Cryobaby labels.
Aliquot 75uL of Orf1B primer-probe mix into each tube
Put a blue sticker on the cap of each tube
Fill a bucket with ice
Wrap 1mL falcon tubes of IDT RnaseP in aluminum foil
Thaw IDT RnaseP aliquots on ice
Homogenize the aliquots completely
Label 45 1.5mL amber tubes with printed IDT RnaseP Cryobaby labels.
Aliquot 315uL of IDT RnaseP into each tube
Put a red sticker on the cap of each tube
Obtain a sealed 500mL bottle of water
Transfer 700uL of water into a suitable container or tube.

contentItems.text: Prepare RT-qPCR Reaction Mix for Each Probe Set.

checklist.Text: Fill a bucket with ice and thaw all reagents
Thaw samples you plan to test on ice
Centrifuge samples for 1 minute at 3000 rpm (4℃)
Calculate the total volume of reaction mix needed for each plate
Prepare the necessary volume of reaction mix in a 15 ml conical tube
Put reaction mix on ice
Thoroughly mix by slowly inverting the tube up and down several times, quick spin to bring to bottom
Record all lot numbers, expiration dates and amount used in rtPCR_reagent_tracking sheet

contentItems.text: Prepare to Add Reaction Mix to 384 well plate using MANTIS

checklist.Text: Turn on the MANTIS instrument
Sign in to the BBI laptop computer and open the "MANTIS Liquid Handler Control Software"
Place the Orf1b and S assay chips onto separate chip holders
Place the conical tubes containing your previously mixed qPCR reaction mixes into the MANTIS tube holders
Make sure labeled, chip-specific tubing is connecting each chip to the appropriate master mix and is secured by lab tape to the tube holder

contentItems.text: Load Dispense List in the MANTIS Control Software

checklist.Text: Click the “Load Dispense List” icon and select the “CLIA -S & ORF1B 5uL.dl.txt” template
Verify that the program will dispense the S assay into rows A, C, E, G, I, K, M, O and dispense the Orf1b assay into rows B, D, F, H, J, L, N, P (Figure 2)
Place the 384-well plate onto the plate holder and ensure that it is evenly flat across the surface of the instrument

contentItems.text: Dispense Reaction Mix Into 384 well plate using MANTIS

checklist.Text: Modify the plate number to the number of plates you plan to fill
press the Run Dispense green button and allow MANTIS to dispense master mixes into designated wells (Figure 1)
Cover with foil seal and briefly spin down the plate at 3000 rpm (4℃)
Verify that the DI-water and 70% Ethanol wash reservoirs towards the back of the MANTIS are over half full
transfer the master mix end of each set of tubing to a set of new 1.5mL microfuge tubes placed in the white tube holders
Attach the end of the tubing onto the clip for stability
Once the machine has completed the wash cycle, discard waste microfuge tubes, dry tubing with a kimwipe, and return tubing and chips to their respective storage containers
Wipe down surface of metal chip adapters and mantis surfaces with 70% ethanol. If any master mix has spilled or splashed, also use bleach solution or DNAZap on nonmetal surfaces
Note the BBI and NWGC plate names on plate tracking sheet

For plates that have been extracted: remove tips from positions H11 and H12 from a 20uL (red) Liquidator tip box. Place the tip box onto the tip box holder and place the 384-well plate next to it on the beige 384-well adapter. Position the 384-well into the lower-right corner
Place the sample plate in front of the red tip box. Load the tips onto the liquidator
Carefully mix the samples in the sample plate by pipetting up and down, being careful not to create bubbles in the wells
Transfer 5uL of sample volume from the sample plate into the 384-well
Move the 384-well test plate to all four corners of the adapter (in a backwards Z pattern) and then transfer 5uL at a time (with tips at positions H11 and H12 removed)

contentItems.text: Using a fresh pipette tip for each addition, add 5uL of positive control Gblock OR water into indicated wells.

checklist.Text: pipette from S PTC into O21
pipette from S PTC into O22
pipette from Orf2b PTC into P21
pipette from Orf2b PTC into P22
pipette from Water into O23
pipette from Water into O24
pipette from Water into P23
pipette from Water into P24

contentItems.text: Seal Plate, clean PCR hood and document work

checklist.Text: Tightly seal the plate using a clear BioRad Microseal B seal
briefly spin the plate at 3000 rpm (room temp) to spin down the sample reaction mix
Clean the PCR hood with bleach solution, then water, and then with 70% ethanol
Scan the barcode of the 384-well into relevant cell of ‘Latch Rack List’ document
Place the plate on ice
follow QuantStudio 6 SOP for starting the qPCR

contentItems.text: Prepare Liquidator for plates that have been heat-treated for Swab Express (formerly SwabDirect)

checklist.Text: Remove the tip from position H12 from a 20uL (red) Liquidator tip box
Place the tip box onto the tip box holder
Place the 384-well plate next to the tip box on the beige 384-well adapter
Position the 384-well into the lower-right corner
Place the sample plate in front of the red tip box
Load the tips onto the liquidator
Carefully mix the samples in the sample plate by pipetting up and down, being careful not to create bubbles in the wells
Transfer 5uL of sample volume from the sample plate into the 384-well
Move the 384-well test plate to all four corners of the adapter (in a backwards Z pattern) and then transfer 5uL at a time (with tips H12 removed)

contentItems.text: Using a fresh pipette tip for each addition, add 5uL of control Hap1-RNA+Gblock to indicated wells

checklist.Text: pipette from Hap1-RNA+gBlock control into O23
pipette from Hap1-RNA+gBlock control into O24
pipette from Hap1-RNA+gBlock control into P23
pipette from Hap1-RNA+gBlock control into P24

contentItems.text: Seal Plate, clean PCR hood and document work

checklist.Text: Tightly seal the plate using a clear BioRad Microseal B seal
briefly spin the plate at 3000 rpm (room temp) to spin down the sample reaction mix
Clean the PCR hood with bleach solution, then water, and then with 70% ethanol
Scan the barcode of the 384-well into relevant cell of ‘Latch Rack List’ document
Place the plate on ice
follow QuantStudio 6 SOP for starting the qPCR
